newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt shares rise in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Egypt shares rise in quiet trade.

text.p: Egyptian share prices on Sunday continued their slow climb out of the doldrums, with Medinet Nasr Housing and Development generating most of the day's trade.
The Capital Market Authority (CMA) all-share index gained 0.28 points to end at 335.46 but volume was a below-average 37.73 ($11 million).
The market on Tuesday hit its lowest level since mid-January but a rise on Thursday's bourse reversed the downtrend.

"There was a turnaround in many stocks on today's market. Most quality stocks rose due to the fact that people realise the prices are low these days and are taking advantage of this," said Mohammed Abdullah, managing director of Intercapital Brokerage.
"The trend has been towards slipping. The market might not climb a lot over the next few weeks but I think it has hit the bottom and will slowly rise," he added.
Medinet Nasr Housing and Development was the day's most active share, closing 11.25 pounds higher at 237 after trading in 11.40 million pounds.
Abdullah said interest in the company was generated by market expectations that the housing firm would soon issue global depository receipts.
Helwan Portland Cement climbed 2.6 pounds to close at 69.1 after shares worth 2.85 million pounds changed hands, while Egyptian Tora Portland Cement ended trade 1.49 pounds higher at 86.5.
Several stocks made healthy price gains, including General Silos and Storage which rose 3.93 pounds to 82.68 and East Delta Flour Mills which closed 2.9 pounds higher at 60.9.
Of the 88 shares traded, 39 rose, 28 ended lower and 28 remained unchanged.
The index for openly traded firms fell to 447.47 points from 450.58 points on Thursday and that for the rarely traded "closed" firms rose to 251.32 points from 250.18.
